FBDC51D8B775429E9CB289C04134DF0A.description:
Explore and utilize a
variety of traditional
and/or non-traditional
sound sources and
electronic media and
technology when
composing and arranging
music.

99580A328958466F9C2D705B44002B5A.description:
Utilize both traditional
and/or non-traditional
notation to compose
short pieces within
specified guidelines and
demonstrate one's
knowledge of the
elements of music and
how they might be used to
create unity or variety,
tension and release,
and/or balance.

8BBD6BB448434EA2A5D813FEA258A59E.description:
Arrange simple pieces for
voices and instruments
using performing forces
and expressive qualities
other than those originally
utilized in the piece in
ways that preserve the
expressive affect of the
music.

195A388C0FE04B7197E554759DEAB32C.description:
Anchor Standard 11: Create a varied repertoire of music by composing and arranging music with both traditional and non-traditional
notation.

3182890815A34AB6AED6C96D187B95EB.description:
Use movement, gesture,
traditional, and/or nontraditional music notation
to demonstrate pitch and
rhythm patterns, motifs,
and short melodies that
are aurally perceived
and/or audiated.

6AA996F571FD49D5AB46024B7455643D.description: Anchor Standard 10: Create a varied repertoire of music by representing audiated and aurally perceived music.

02D9A6DC2A324E758DA1A72F2104323B.description:
Recognize important
pitches within a melody
and improvise simple
harmonic
accompaniments.

D60707FC97E94FCF9B2DB3F714961FB7.description:
Improvise rhythmic and
melodic embellishments
and variations using a
pentatonic scale and
major keys.

4F826C0316024FE89B02E90C881BAD8B.description:
Improvise short,
unaccompanied rhythms
and melodies with
consistent style, meter,
and/or tonality.

9B5AD815167D4FCBB776F66462D211A1.description: Anchor Standard 9: Create a varied repertoire of music by improvising melodies, variations, and accompaniments

9981F08548754F998DD92D4A8C78D96A.description:
Maintain pitch and
rhythm accuracy, tone
quality, tonal center, a
steady beat, appropriate
technique, and
appropriate style while
playing unpitched,
melodic, and harmonic
instruments to portray the
composer's intent.

9DD954F5DCB3408581044BDED13A33B2.description:
Play both rhythmic and
tonal ostinati, canon,
counter melodies,
drones, and descants, as
modeled and/or visually
notated, to create
harmony and play
instruments in two and/or
three parts.

5D2AE446C34748078B885F6F69DE6448.description:
Play unpitched, melodic,
and harmonic instruments
with expression and
technical accuracy, as
modeled and/or visually
notated, and portray
appropriate style.

F29F1ABFAC694890B1C6AF155C181A93.description:
Play accurate pitches and
rhythms, as modeled
and/or visually notated, in
tune with a steady beat,
good tone quality, and
appropriate technique
throughout the known
range of the instrument(s).

8E8C033619F14781B5A64B737BF3C09B.description:
Anchor Standard 8: Perform a varied repertoire of music by playing instruments, alone and with others, from rote memory and
written notation.

85DA45F621E54FBD93C06BDB521C80F3.description:
Maintain pitch and
rhythmic accuracy, tone
quality, tonal center, a
steady beat, and
appropriate style while
singing both with
accompaniment and a
cappella to portray the
composer's intent.

DCD56C3574634129B7EC0AF30FEC2086.description:
Sing tonal ostinati, canon,
counter melodies, drones,
or descants, as modeled
and/or visually notated, to
create harmony and sing
in two and/or three parts.

966440D8B09A4231BC048D83CDB9E5E2.description:
Sing with expressive
qualities and technical
accuracy, as modeled
and/or visually notated,
and portray appropriate
style.

7140A0D171484A6D9E24B8BAEF7D53D3.description:
Sing accurate pitches and
rhythms, as modeled
and/or visually notated,
with appropriate
intonation, breath
control, diction, and
tone quality throughout
one's singing range.

F2740B08A96E43EDB0E092802D30C5C9.description: Anchor Standard 7: Perform a varied repertoire of music by singing, alone and with others, from rote memory and written notation

7234C37343B74ACCB27FB0EE0A659D2F.description:
Identify and express age
appropriate music
concepts including form,
phrasing, expressive
qualities, and timbre
through movement in
listening examples,
singing games and/or
simple folk dances.

1ABEB6D321DC4D01A398CCBCDA8F2401.description:
Identify and express the
elements of music
manifest in specific
musical examples through
choreographed folk
dances and explore the
role of dance in various
cultures.

61D3CA56CB724C2DABE3968716D98801.description:
Explore the muscular
sensations of time and
energy through the
performance of
choreographed
movement, including
conducting, both in place
and in space.

1BED474AA8924E04BE33CF2091E05E1B.description: Anchor Standard 6: Listen and respond to a varied repertoire of music by interpreting and expressing music through movement

9BAE58D3CE8244B4B683263F96EEBF4C.description:
Develop criteria for
evaluating the quality and
effectiveness of music
performers, performances,
and compositions and
apply the criteria to music
that is listened to,
performed, and/or created.

262650AB11184B6AB37E7F5B73618F59.description:
Identify elements of
music and analyze and
describe how they
manifest in a musical
example.

F36AEB261B2A4793827842A171B33B55.description:
Recall, explore,
comprehend, and apply
appropriate music
vocabulary.

A84B8B0796AA4914A8528A2C5B94DD26.description:
Anchor Standard 5: Listen and respond to a varied repertoire of music by describing, interpreting, analyzing, and evaluating music
and its elemental components.

9928B5777CC9472F9708EE4F9DEB41B6.description:
Audiate and accurately
sing and perform pitch
and rhythm patterns,
motifs, and melodies in
both major and minor
modes and simple and
compound meters on
sight.

0794046A8E8C4AACA09FD71E1CD07E35.description:
Audiate and recognize
age appropriate pitch and
rhythm patterns, motifs,
and known melodies from
movement, gesture,
traditional, or nontraditional notation.

4FECD10F7BEE4DBFA1E7B78095D01F76.description: Anchor Standard 4: Listen and respond to a varied repertoire of music by audiating music.

BCB2FFF362A04FB1A6E6365A142B54BC.description:
Compare and contrast, in
various cultures and
historical periods, the
functions of music, the
roles of musicians, and
the conditions under
which participation in
music typically occurs.

B85AF934AE0E42F3B5BDC91F404FC8FA.description:
Identify, describe, and
apply through
performance uniquely
American music genres,
trace their evolution, and
explore the life and work
of musicians associated
with each.

720B9DC58CAA489E99AFD53F8FCC85D0.description:
Identify, describe, and
perform the distinguishing
characteristics of musical
works from a variety of
genres, styles, historical
periods, and cultures.

FA6E365A03C24915B0EC6F5375AE5BEA.description: Anchor Standard 3: Connect with a varied repertoire of music by exploring the relationships between music and history and culture

AF0EE82B9EF24E06948B151AA7189D45.description:
Apply music for learning
and recalling knowledge
and information in other
disciplines.

9F3BC8C1C556440FB95C6A7D803CAEFD.description:
Compare and describe
how the characteristic
elements of music and the
other arts can be used to
depict and/or transform
events, scenes, emotions,
and/or ideas into works of
art.

11EF807F426E45CD8A9CF8C1A84AA6A0.description:
Describe and explore how
the study of music applies
to language arts,
mathematics, and/or
science.

611B00B1B4F64EEE87FF801AE55D76E5.description:
Anchor Standard 2: Connect with a varied repertoire of music by exploring the relationships between music, the other arts, and
disciplines outside the arts.

61D95026431B480796B7FA5F126D5B1E.description:
Identify various uses of
music in daily life and
describe the
characteristics that make
music suitable for a
specific use.

BA8A6D65F5DD4258BC50A9987F9BF7A7.description:
Identify and demonstrate
individual preference for
music that is performed,
created, and/or listened
to in daily life.

4B72417034F9498789D4CED554719D12.description:
Anchor Standard 1: Connect with a varied repertoire of music by exploring the relationships between music and personal
experience.
